00040 using namespace std;
00041 
00042 //
00043 void 
00044 WriteUInt32_I(OFSTREAM& outstr,uint32_t val)
00045 {
00046   val = htoil(val);
00047         outstr.write((char *)&val,sizeof(val));
00048 }
00049 void
00050 WriteInt32_I(OFSTREAM& outstr,int32_t val)
00051 {
00052   WriteUInt32_I(outstr,(uint32_t)val);
00053 }
00054 //
00055 void 
00056 WriteUInt32_N(OFSTREAM& outstr,uint32_t val)
00057 {
00058   val = htonl(val);
00059         outstr.write((char *)&val,sizeof(val));
00060 }
00061 void
00062 WriteInt32_N(OFSTREAM& outstr,int32_t val)
00063 {
00064   WriteUInt32_N(outstr,(uint32_t)val);
00065 }
00066 
00067 //
00068 void
00069 WriteUInt16_I(OFSTREAM& outstr,uint16_t val)
00070 {
00071   val = htois(val);
00072         outstr.write((char *)&val,sizeof(val));
00073 }
00074 void
00075 WriteInt16_I(OFSTREAM& outstr,int16_t val)
00076 {
00077   WriteUInt16_I(outstr,(uint16_t)val);
00078 }
00079 void
00080 WriteUInt16_N(OFSTREAM& outstr,uint16_t val)
00081 {
00082   val = htons(val);
00083         outstr.write((char *)&val,sizeof(val));
00084 }
00085 void
00086 WriteInt16_N(OFSTREAM& outstr,int16_t val)
00087 {
00088   WriteUInt16_N(outstr,(uint16_t)val);
00089 }
00090 
00091 //
00092 void 
00093 WriteUInt8(OFSTREAM& outstr,uint8_t val)
00094 {
00095         outstr.write((char *)&val,sizeof(val));
00096 }
00097 void 
00098 WriteInt8(OFSTREAM& outstr,int8_t val)
00099 {
00100   WriteUInt8(outstr,(uint8_t)val);
00101 }

00103 //
00104 void 
00105 WriteFloat_I(OFSTREAM& outstr,float fval)
00106 {
00107   type_punned pun;
00108   pun.v_float=fval;
00109         WriteUInt32_I(outstr,pun.v_uint32);
00110 }
00111 void 
00112 WriteFloat_N(OFSTREAM& outstr,float fval)
00113 {
00114   type_punned pun;
00115   pun.v_float=fval;
00116         WriteUInt32_N(outstr,pun.v_uint32);
00117 }
00118 
00119 // Customers wanted repeatablity with old
00120 // text files with only had a single digit after the decimal point.
00121 
00122 void
00123 WriteFloatLowPrecision(OFSTREAM& outstr,float fval)
00124 {
00125   fval=(float)((floor((fval+0.05)*10))/10.0);
00126         WriteFloat_I(outstr,fval);
00127 }

00129 //====================
00130 
00131 // normal C strings.
00132 void 
00133 WriteFixedCString(OFSTREAM& outstr,const char* str,size_t outlen)
00134 {
00135   uint32_t slen=(uint32_t)strlen(str);
00136   outstr.write(str,((outlen<slen)?(uint32_t)outlen:slen));
00137   // pad with nulls
00138   for (uint32_t i=slen;i<outlen;i++) {
00139     outstr.put(0);
00140   }
00141 }
00142 
00143 void 
00144 WriteCString(OFSTREAM& outstr,const char* str)
00145 {
00146   uint32_t slen=(uint32_t)strlen(str);
00147         WriteUInt32_I(outstr,slen);
00148   WriteFixedCString(outstr,str,slen);
00149 }
00150 void 
00151 WriteCString(OFSTREAM& outstr,std::string str)
00152 {
00153   WriteCString(outstr,str.c_str());
00154 }
00155 
00156 // C++ strings
00157 
00158 void 
00159 WriteFixedString(OFSTREAM& outstr,const std::string str,size_t outlen)
00160 {
00161   WriteFixedCString(outstr,str.c_str(),outlen);
00162 }
00163 
00164 void
00165 WriteString_I(OFSTREAM& outstr,const std::string str)
00166 {
00167         WriteCString(outstr,str.c_str());
00168 }
00169 
00170 void
00171 WriteString_N(OFSTREAM& outstr,const std::string str)
00172 {
00173         int len = (int) str.length();
00174         WriteInt32_N(outstr, len);
00175         WriteFixedString(outstr, str, len);
00176 }
00177 
00178 // Character Array
00179 void
00180 WriteCharacterArray(OFSTREAM& outstr, char *c, size_t outlen)
00181 {
00182         for (uint32_t i=0; i<outlen; i++) { outstr.put(c[i]); }
00183 }
